span.a: You are currently on this page - Flexible Learning Resources

td.p: Welcome to the District's Flexible Learning page. While we understand that distance learning is NOT a replacement for in-class learning, we want to make sure that our students are able to continue their learning and keep up with skills during the time we are asked to be at home.
We are grateful to have our teachers and administrators working each day on and with these tools, and for the impact technology will have on learning continuity.
Each level students will have a different expectation for learning during the next several weeks. Take a look below and find the resource(s) meant for you or your student(s).
Again, we thank you for your flexiblity, understanding, and willingness to dive into this new experience with us.

The goal at the elementary level is to provide all students with appropriate learning experiences they can pursue at home. These activities are designed to ensure students maintain and build their skills, and include but are not limited to: physical play, the arts, reading, writing, math and more. Some of these may include the use of technology, but are not dependent upon technology.

As a guideline, it is recommended that students in 4K-4th Grade engage in the learning opportunities 60-90 minutes per day. You can also look forward to hearing from your child’s classroom teacher prior to the end of the week (via email or classroom social media such as Google Classroom, SeeSaw, or other). Please monitor your email regularly throughout this closure as this will be the primary means of district communication.

td.a: Spanish Translations - Actividades de aprendizaje continuo para 4K-4

td.p: The Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction permits the use of Virtual Learning Time in situations in which students are unable to meet face-to-face. PI 8 was recently amended, and the DPI provides guidance on its website for Virtual Learning Time. The Kaukauna Area School District has elected to utilize Virtual Learning Time during the period of time in which our schools are closed as a result of the COVID-19 Virus in grades 5-12, not because it is a DPI requirement, but because it is the right thing to do for our students to ensure continuity of learning.
Teachers will be communicating with students enrolled in their classes about how to proceed with virtual learning for their classes.

p.strong: Please communicate with your student(s) in Grades 5-12 that they should check their District e-mail for information from their classroom teachers. Some classrooms have already been using Google Classroom or other online platforms. Students may receive updates via those platforms as well.

td.p: If you have additional questions about these virtual learning days, check out our Virtual Learning FAQ document (which will be regularly updating to include new questions as they arise) or have your student contact their teacher directly.

li.a: Options for Reading and Writing at Home
Google Classroom Basics - For parents and students

div.div:
The Kaukauna Area School District is committed to meeting accessibility requirements and making information available in accordance with the American with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 508. The website and pages within are regularly monitored and updated to provide an accessible and friendly user experience. If you have additional questions, please view our full disclaimer
